intro: Triticum inflatum var. alborubroinflatum-capitatum, commonly known as the red-capped wheatgrass, is a rare and ornamental variant of wheatgrass characterized by its distinctive reddish inflorescence. It is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to certain regions of Central Asia. The plant features long, narrow leaves with a bluish-green hue and produces dense, spike-like flower clusters that turn a vibrant red as they mature. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens and as a decorative plant. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a botanical curiosity.
